page.title: 07STANSTEAD ABBOTTS-RELIEF
page.content: {SQUARES 3812 & 3912 Arable{FARMING}is the dominant land use in the area, most of the land being owned by one family, who farm at Home Farm. They grow a variety of crops which are rotated annually. The crops include oil seed rape, winter wheat, winter and spring barley, spring beans which are sold for pigeon food, durum wheat used to make pasta, and grass. The grass is used when the land lies fallow for a year, and it is then grazed by racehorses from Newmarket. They also have a small number of beef cattle. The steep valley side prevents any possible expansion of the village of Stanstead Abbotts, and conceals the built-up area of the valley floor from the view of the farmhouse, which looks over to the other side of the valley.
